def: A threne, or threnody; a dirge; a funeral song.

An adherent of Nestorius, patriarch of Constantinople to thefifth century, who has condemned as a heretic for maintaining thatthe divine and the human natures were not merged into one nature inChrist (who was God in man), and, hence, that it was improper to callMary the mother of Christ; also, one of the sect established by thefollowers of Nestorius in Persia, india, and other Orientalcountries, and still in existence. opposed to Ant: Eutychian.
The state or quality of being congenial; natural affinity;adaptation; suitableness.  Sir J. Reynolds.
The quality of being amenable; amenableness. Coleridge.
A castrated bull. [Prov. Eng. & Scot.] Halliwell.
A privy, or water-closet, esp. in a camp, hospital, etc.
Abounding with gravel; consisting of gravel; as, a gravellysoil.
Pertaining to a poem, or to poetry; poetical. [R.] Coleridge.
Any butterfly of the genus Pieris and related genera. SeeCabbage butterfly, under Cabbage.
To set in order; to adorn; to deck, to embellish; to trim.Shak.
